pr_title: CLDR-13836 fix script for dogri, the generation program, and default …

timeline.message: CLDR-13836 fix script for dogri, the generation program, and default for EU to en-IE (now that GB has left, would change to German if we just went by country, so this restores an en)
CLDR-13836 fix issues with Dogri. Retracts nv from Locales.txt, but leaves the XML file in place for the future (in seed).
CLDR-13836 Add core data for Dogri (was 13813)

timeline.bodyText: Need to also update tools/java/org/unicode/cldr/util/data/language_script_raw.txt  or this will just be overwritten
timeline.author: pedberg-icu
timeline.diffHunk:
@@ -1499,8 +1499,8 @@ XXX Code for transations where no currency is involved
 		<language type="dng" scripts="Cyrl"/>
 		<language type="dnj" scripts="Latn"/>
 		<language type="dnj" territories="CI" alt="secondary"/>
-		<language type="doi" scripts="Arab"/>
-		<language type="doi" scripts="Takr" territories="IN" alt="secondary"/>
+		<language type="doi" scripts="Deva"/>
+		<language type="doi" scripts="Arab Takr" territories="IN" alt="secondary"/>

timeline.bodyText:
Need to also update tools/java/org/unicode/cldr/util/data/country_language_population_raw.txt or this will get overwritten. Also:

I am not sure that hi_Latn is the same as Hinglish.
I believe that hi_Latn has usage greater than 1% in India - certainly on devices such as smartphones and computers - but I do not have data for this.
timeline.author: pedberg-icu
timeline.diffHunk:
@@ -3143,7 +3143,8 @@ XXX Code for transations where no currency is involved
 			<languagePopulation type="gv" populationPercent="1.9" officialStatus="official"/>	<!--Manx-->
 		</territory>
 		<territory type="IN" gdp="9474000000000" literacyPercent="62.8" population="1296830000">	<!--India-->
-			<languagePopulation type="hi" populationPercent="41" officialStatus="official" references="R1066"/>	<!--Hindi-->
+            <languagePopulation type="hi" populationPercent="41" officialStatus="official" references="R1066"/> <!--Hindi-->
+            <languagePopulation type="hi_Latn" populationPercent="1"/> <!-- Hinglish -->

timeline.bodyText: Since this is not coming from country_language_population_raw.txt, isn't there an override we have to add somewhere to keep this from getting overwritten during the BRS process?
timeline.author: pedberg-icu
timeline.diffHunk:
@@ -3014,8 +3014,8 @@ not be patched by hand, as any changes made in that fashion may be lost.
 		<!--{ ?; ?; Spain } => { Spanish; Latin; Spain }-->
 		<likelySubtag from="und_ET" to="am_Ethi_ET"/>
 		<!--{ ?; ?; Ethiopia } => { Amharic; Ethiopic; Ethiopia }-->
-		<likelySubtag from="und_EU" to="en_Latn_GB"/>
-		<!--{ ?; ?; European Union } => { English; Latin; United Kingdom }-->
+		<likelySubtag from="und_EU" to="en_Latn_IE"/>
+		<!--{ ?; ?; European Union } => { English; Latin; Ireland }-->

replies.bodyText:
I made those changes, and reran the tools.
supplementalMetaData - unchanged
likelySubtags - changed (but not doi)
	<likelySubtag from="hi_Latn" to="hi_Latn_IN"/>
	<!--{ Hindi; Latin; ? } => { Hindi; Latin; India }-->

Redundant, since 		
	<likelySubtag from="ks_Deva" to="ks_Deva_IN"/>
	<!--{ Kashmiri; Devanagari; ? } => { Kashmiri; Devanagari; India }-->

Redundant, since 		
	<likelySubtag from="ms_ID" to="ms_Latn_ID"/>
	<!--{ Malay; ?; Indonesia } => { Malay; Latin; Indonesia }-->

Redundant, since 		
Will have to do some research on ks.
replies.author: macchiati

timeline.message: CLDR-13836 Made sure to run generation programs: ConvertLanguage and MaximalLocales. Nothing surprising, but found that there were some unaddressed warnings. So changed the code to expose what was happening for the future.
